customer_reviews.title: Money saver !
customer_reviews.text: So far it's been great! The center piece is a bit of a pain to clean but that was to be expected. You just have to rinse it at just the right angle to get the grounds completely out. I have to say I've saved a decent amount of money since I no longer go to Starbucks for cold brew. EDIT: Minus a couple stars. I went to clean it and it light hit my super delicate scotch glass and IT shattered not my glencairn glass. Impressed but the sturdiness of the glencairn. Really disappointed in the sturdiness of this brewer.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren V.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pot!
customer_reviews.text: I've had my pot for about 3 weeks now and can say I'm very pleased with the product. The majority of cold brew pots work via the same steeping concept, but this one has the added benefit of being extremely durable. I've whacked this baby against the granite countertops several times now (I'm not as graceful as I used to be) and thankfully the pot has come out unscathed every time. Another nice touch is that the opening is large enough that I can fit my hand inside. Much, much easier to clean it thoroughly this way.
customer_reviews.author: LilaSkye

customer_reviews.title: Love My Brand New Cold Brew Coffee Maker!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been paying a premium for my cold brewed coffees at Starbucks for a while now but it’s all over now with this little fella. Yes, I have to think ahead and put the coffee into the fridge the night before but it totally worth it. 1) I save a ton of money per cup 2) it’s been awesome to experiment with different roasts 3) it is so convenient to have this stuff sitting right in my fridge. The product itself is quality. Put it the dishwasher no problem. Looks beautiful. So far this cold brewer has exceeded my expectations!

product_meta.title: Cold Brew Coffee Maker - Stylish & EXTRA DURABLE 40oz/1.2L Glass Pitcher With Spout & Removable Stainless Steel Filter, Brews Perfectly Smooth Coffee Every Time, Ideal Refreshment For A Hot Summer Day
product_meta.description:
Why Cold Brewed Coffee?

It’s simple: Cold brewing is one of the easiest, most rewarding, least complicated ways to make great coffee. In a world of drive-thru fast food and instant gratification, cold brew coffee flies in the face of the status quo to say that faster isn’t always better and good things come to those who wait.

The 5 Steps To Cold Brewed Coffee: 

Step 1: Add 1 - 1.25 cups of medium or heavy coarse coffee grounds directly into the filter

Step 2: Pour lukewarm filtered water over the grounds until you reach the 40oz line.

Step 3: Place into the fridge and patiently wait for 16 hours.

Step 4: Once brewing process has been completed, simply remove the filter and wet grounds from the carafe, clean and store for next use.

Step 5: To serve, mix your cold brew concentrate with ice, water, or milk to create your perfect drink. Cold brew can be stored safely in your fridge for up to two weeks.

Roasts Great For Cold Brewing

Starbucks Espresso Roast.This is a multi-region blend that Starbucks uses for espresso in its stores. This is one of the darkest roasts you will encounter and when coarsely ground and cold brewed has smooth, caramelly sweet notes. ~$13/lb.

Peet’s Baridi.This is an East African blend specifically designed by Peet’s Coffee to be served cold. A dark roast with a smooth, bold flavor with a clean finish, it is great for mixing with milk or drinking straight. More aromatic than most cold brews. You’ll love it. ~$16/lb.

BlueBottle Single Origin Columbia Bilbao Los Vascos. A fruity, medium roast with complex citrusy notes. It is too delicious not to mention. Enjoy it over ice and wonder how a single origin produced so many different flavors. ~$23/12oz.
